Fix flaw in heuristic for inferring exon ranks in makeTxDbFromGRanges()

makeTxDbFromGRanges() can guess the exon ranks of a given transcript either

  (a) based on their position on the chromosome

  (b) or by looking at the suffixes of the exon ids (e.g. .1, .2, etc...)
      if any

Previously (i.e. in GenomicFeatures < 1.53.1) it was trying (b) first, and
would fall back on (a) if (b) failed.

Starting with GenomicFeatures 1.53.1, it does the opposite: it tries (a)
first, and uses (b) only for exons for which (a) failed.

This change addresses the problem that the suffixes of the exon ids cannot
be trusted to infer the ranks of exons located on the minus strand. See
https://github.com/Bioconductor/GenomicFeatures/issues/59 for an example.

Fix issue with order of sequences in seqinfo(makeTxDbFromUCSC())

For a **registered** UCSC genome 'genome', the seqinfo() of the TxDb
object returned by 'makeTxDbFromUCSC(genome, ...)' is expected to be
identical to 'getChromInfoFromUCSC(genome, as.Seqinfo=TRUE)'. However,
for some genomes (e.g. felCat9), this was not the case. This is now
fixed.

Small update to makeTxDbFromGFF()/makeTxDbFromGRanges()

makeTxDbFromGFF() and makeTxDbFromGRanges() now recognize and
import features of type "gene_segment", "pseudogenic_gene_segment",
"antisense_RNA", "three_prime_overlapping_ncrna", or "vault_RNA",
as transcripts. This was achieved by adding these Sequence Ontology
terms to GenomicFeatures:::.TX_TYPES.

Important note about the "gene_segment" and "pseudogenic_gene_segment"
terms: According to the Sequence Ontology these terms are not offsprings
of the "transcript" term via the **is_a** relationship but we still treat
them as if they were because that's what Ensembl does in their GFF3 files.

Handle exons with no Parent attribute in makeTxDbFromGFF()

GFF3 files that contain exons with no Parent attribute no longer break
makeTxDbFromGRanges() or makeTxDbFromGFF(). The orphan exons are dropped.

Avoid "file association for 'http://...' not available or invalid" error
during 'R CMD check' on some Windows systems (e.g. riesling1).

Improve handling of GFF3 files from Ensembl in makeTxDbFromGFF()

When genes have a "gene_id" attribute and/or transcripts have
a "transcript_id" attribute, then makeTxDbFromGRanges() and
makeTxDbFromGFF() now use this instead of the "Name" attribute
to import the gene ids and/or transcript names in the "gene_id"
and "tx_name" columns of the TxDb object.

This change has 2 benefits:

  1. Unlike "Name", the "gene_id" and "transcript_id" attributes are
     expected to contain **unique** ids. For example in a GFF3 file
     from Ensembl, the "Name" attribute will contain things like "DDX11L1",
     "WASH7P", or "WASH7P-201", that are not necessarily unique across the
     gene or transcript features. Whereas the "gene_id" and "transcript_id"
     attributes typically contain Ensembl ids (e.g. "ENSG00000223972",
     "ENSG00000227232", or "ENST00000488147") which are guaranteed to be
     unique.

  2. With this change, the values imported in the "gene_id" and "tx_name"
     columns of the TxDb object should no longer depend on the format of
     the file (i.e. GTF or GFF3) when importing a file from Ensembl.
small tweak

makeTxDbFromGFF() recognizes more GFF3 feature types as transcripts or genes

More SO terms that are commonly found in the type column of a
GFF3 file are now recognized as being "transcript features" (e.g.
unconfirmed_transcript, V_gene_segment, D_gene_segment, C_gene_segment,
J_gene_segment), or "gene features" (e.g. ncRNA_gene).

These new terms are used in GFF3 files produced by Ensembl (e.g.
in Homo_sapiens.GRCh38.102.gff3.gz) but they were not recognized
by makeTxDbFromGRanges() or makeTxDbFromGFF() thus resulting in
many transcripts and genes not being imported in the TxDb object.

This partially addresses GitHub issue #28.

Implement a restricted seqinfo() setter for TxDb objects

Implement a restricted seqinfo() setter for TxDb objects that supports
altering only the seqlevels and/or genome of the object, but not its
seqlengths or circularity flags. This is all we need to make the improved
seqlevelsStyle() setter work on TxDb objects.

3 other breaking changes:

- Argument 'goldenPath_url' was renamed 'goldenPath.url' in functions

  and makeFDbPackageFromUCSC().

minor cosmetic

makeTxDbFromGFF() recognizes more features as transcripts, exons, or CDS

- New features recognized as transcripts: scRNA, telomerase_RNA, vault_RNA,
  and Y_RNA. These are valid Sequence Ontology terms that are all offsprings
  of the term "transcript".

- New features recognized as exons: coding_exon, five_prime_coding_exon,
  interior_coding_exon, three_prime_coding_exon, exon_of_single_exon_gene,
  interior_exon, noncoding_exon, five_prime_noncoding_exon,
  three_prime_noncoding_exon. These are valid Sequence Ontology terms that
  are all offsprings of the term "exon".

- New features recognized as CDS: transposable_element_CDS, CDS_predicted,
  edited_CDS. These are valid Sequence Ontology terms that are all
  offsprings of the term "CDS".

Note that these changes were made to makeTxDbFromGRanges(), which is the
workhorse behind makeTxDbFromGFF().

makeTxDbFromGFF() now recognizes guide_RNA features as transcripts

Also when the function drops orphan features (exons, CDS, or stop codons),
the warning message now reports how many were dropped.

Note that the 2 above changes were made in makeTxDbFromGRanges(), which is
the workhorse behind makeTxDbFromGFF().

Small improvement to exonicParts() and intronicParts()

- When 'linked.to.single.gene.only' is set to TRUE, exonicParts() now
  returns an additional "exonic_part" metadata column that indicates the
  rank of each exonic part within all the exonic parts linked to the same
  gene. This is for compatibility with old disjointExons().

- intronicParts() does something similar except that the additional metadata
  column is named "intronic_part".

minor edit to comment

Fix makeTxDbFromUCSC() on hg19/refGene and hg38/refGene tables

The refGene tables in UCSC databases hg19 and hg38 were last updated
in Nov 2018 and now contain transcripts located on sequences that do
NOT belong to the corresponding genomes (GRCh37 and GRCh38 respectively).
More precisely some transcripts in these tables now belong to **patched**
versions of these genomes: GRCh37.p13 for hg19 and GRCh38.p11 for hg38.
This causes the makeTxDbFromUCSC() errors reported here:
  - https://github.com/Bioconductor/GenomicFeatures/issues/14
  - https://support.bioconductor.org/p/117265/
  - https://support.bioconductor.org/p/114901/

The current fix is to drop these foreign transcripts with a warning. For
example calling 'makeTxDbFromUCSC(genome="hg38", tablename="refGene")'
now displays the following warning message:

  113 transcripts were dropped because they are on unknown sequences
  (e.g. transcripts NM_024081, NM_001001437, NM_012101, NR_146066, ...)

Support GFF3 files where the CDS parent is an exon instead of a transcript

makeTxDbFromGFF() now supports GFF files where the CDS parent is an exon
instead of a transcript. Note that such GFF3 files are rare and not
following the well established convention documented here:

  https://github.com/The-Sequence-Ontology/Specifications/blob/master/gff3.md

An example of such file is the Pabies01b-gene.gff3.gz located at:

  ftp://plantgenie.org/Data/ConGenIE/Picea_abies/v1.0/GFF3/Gene_Prediction_Transcript_assemblies/

This file is the 2nd file causing problems in the issue reported here:

  https://support.bioconductor.org/p/113547/

makeTxDbFromGRanges() now accepts missing/invalid CDS phases

makeTxDbFromGRanges() now issues a warning instead of an error if any

makeTxDbFromGFF() which uses makeTxDbFromGRanges() internally.

Also temporarily disabling makeTxDbFromUCSC examples

All calls to makeTxDbFromEnsembl() and makeTxDbFromUCSC() fail (with the
error occuring in RMariaDB) on Linux and in the context of 'R CMD check'
but not on Windows or Mac or in an interactive session. So we temporarily
disable all examples and tests that use these functions to give the package
a chance to pass 'R CMD check' on the Bioconductor build system and to
propagate.

For the same reason as with the Ensembl metazoa mart example (see previous
commit), put the Ensembl plants mart example in a \dontrun statement.

The Ensembl metazoa mart is slow and, at the same time, it doesn't seem
to support requests that take more than 1 min at the moment. So a call
to biomaRt::getBM() will fail with a "Timeout was reached" error if the
requested data takes more than 1 min to download. This actually happens
with the makeTxDbFromBiomart() example that queries the Ensembl metazoa
mart so we put it in a \dontrun statement for now.

makeTxDbFromUCSC() now uses direct SQL queries (to the UCSC MySQL server
at genome-mysql.soe.ucsc.edu) instead of rtracklayer::getTable() to fetch
data from the Genome Browser. This avoids the issue reported here
https://github.com/lawremi/rtracklayer/issues/5 . Another benefit is
that direct SQL queries are much faster than rtracklayer::getTable().

git-svn-id: file:///home/git/hedgehog.fhcrc.org/bioconductor/trunk/madman/Rpacks/GenomicFeatures@127827 bc3139a8-67e5-0310-9ffc-ced21a209358

1) Add exonicParts() as an alternative to disjointExons():
    - exonicParts() has a 'linked.to.single.gene.only' argument (FALSE by
      default) that is similar to the 'aggregateGenes' argument of
      disjointExons() but with opposite meaning. More precisely
      'exonicParts(txdb, linked.to.single.gene.only=TRUE)' returns the same
      exonic parts as 'disjointExons(txdb, aggregateGenes=FALSE)'.
    - Unlike 'disjointExons(txdb, aggregateGenes=TRUE)',
      'exonicParts(txdb, linked.to.single.gene.only=FALSE)' does NOT discard
      exon parts that are not linked to a gene.
    - exonicParts() is almost twice more efficient than disjointExons().
2) Add intronicParts(). Similar to exonicParts() but returns intronic parts.

Version bump to trigger package rebuilding now that purl()'ing issue
has been correctly identified. knitr does not create purl()'ed
(Stangle equivalent) .R files if _R_CHECK_TIMINGS_ is set, which
the build system was setting. Now it's not set, so these .R files are
now created. See https://github.com/yihui/knitr/issues/1212 for more.


git-svn-id: file:///home/git/hedgehog.fhcrc.org/bioconductor/trunk/madman/Rpacks/GenomicFeatures@117512 bc3139a8-67e5-0310-9ffc-ced21a209358

Bump version of all packages that use knitr for vignettes.
This is because of an issue (now fixed) in knitr which failed to 
create purl()'ed R files from vignette sources and include them in the
package. This version bump will cause these packages to propagate
with those R files included.

git-svn-id: file:///home/git/hedgehog.fhcrc.org/bioconductor/trunk/madman/Rpacks/GenomicFeatures@117207 bc3139a8-67e5-0310-9ffc-ced21a209358

A couple of changes and improvements to supportedUCSCtables():
- The table names are now returned in a proper column instead of the rownames
  of the returned data frame so this data frame now has 3 columns (tablename,
  track, and subtrack) instead of 2 (track and subtrack).
- Tracks that don't exist for the specified genome are now removed from the
  returned data frame. This cleaning is done by querying the UCSC Genome
  Browser to get the set of tracks for the specified genome (with
  rtracklayer::trackNames()) which slows down supportedUCSCtables() a bit.
  Before this change, supportedUCSCtables() didn't need internet access.

git-svn-id: file:///home/git/hedgehog.fhcrc.org/bioconductor/trunk/madman/Rpacks/GenomicFeatures@113903 bc3139a8-67e5-0310-9ffc-ced21a209358

Rename Hits slots:
  queryHits -> from
  subjectHits -> to
  queryLength -> nLnode (nb of left nodes)
  subjectLength -> nRnode (nb of right nodes)
New accessors are provided that match the new slot names: from(), to(),
nLnode(), nRnode(). The old accessors (queryHits(), subjectHits(),
queryLength(), and subjectLength()) are just aliases for the new accessors.

Also countQueryHits() and countSubjectHits() are now aliases for new
countLnodeHits() and countRnodeHits().

makeTxDbFromGRanges() and makeTxDbFromGFF() now support GFF/GTF files with one 
(or both) of the following peculiarities:
- The file is GTF and contains only lines of type transcript but no
  transcript_id tag (not clear to me this is valid GTF but some users are
  working with this kind of file).
- Each transcript in the file is reported to be on its own contig and spans it
  (start=1) but no strand is reported for the transcript. makeTxDbFromGRanges()
  now sets the strand to "+" for all these transcripts.


git-svn-id: file:///home/git/hedgehog.fhcrc.org/bioconductor/trunk/madman/Rpacks/GenomicFeatures@110293 bc3139a8-67e5-0310-9ffc-ced21a209358

Use S4Vectors:::extract_data_frame_rows() instead of [.data.frame. The former
is up to 2x or 5x faster than the latter when extracting hundreds of thousands
of rows. For example this change leads to a 10%-60% speedup of the
transcriptsBy(), exonsBy(), and cdsBy() extractors when by="gene".

makeTxDbFromGRanges() (and consequently makeTxDbFromGFF()) normally gets the
"gene_id" and "[tx|exon|CDS]_name" columns from the Name tag. This change
implements a new strategy for inferring these columns from the ID tag when
the Name tag is missing.

git-svn-id: file:///home/git/hedgehog.fhcrc.org/bioconductor/trunk/madman/Rpacks/GenomicFeatures@101240 bc3139a8-67e5-0310-9ffc-ced21a209358

Some tweaks and fixes to makeTxDbFromBiomart():

- Drop transcripts with UTR anomalies with a warning instead of failing. We've
  started to see these hopeless transcripts with the release 79 of Ensembl in
  the dmelanogaster_gene_ensembl dataset (based on FlyBase r6.02 / FB2014_05,
  ftp://ftp.flybase.net/genomes/Drosophila_melanogaster/dmel_r6.02_FB2014_05/).
  With this change, the user can still make a TxDb for
  dmelanogaster_gene_ensembl but some transcripts (9 with Ensembl 79) will be
  dropped with a warning.

- BioMart data anomaly warnings and errors now show the first 3 transcripts
  instead of 6.

- Fix issue causing the download of 'chrominfo' data frame to fail when
  querying the primary Ensembl mart (with host="ensembl.org" and
  biomart="ENSEMBL_MART_ENSEMBL").  


git-svn-id: file:///home/git/hedgehog.fhcrc.org/bioconductor/trunk/madman/Rpacks/GenomicFeatures@101187 bc3139a8-67e5-0310-9ffc-ced21a209358

Fix issue with error reporting code in makeTxDbFromBiomart(): when some
transcripts failed to pass the sanity checks, the error message was displaying
the wrong transcripts. More precisely, many good transcripts were mistakenly
added to the set of bad transcripts and included in the error message.

external gene id to transcripts that couldn't otherwise be linked to a gene.
This is for compatibility with some GFF3 files from FlyBase (see for example
dmel-1000-r5.11.filtered.gff included in this package).

Add "tx_type" column to SQLite schema of TxDb objects and bump their
DBSCHEMAVERSION to 1.1.

IMPORTANT NOTE: GenomicFeatures still works with TxDb objects that use the old
schema (DBSCHEMAVERSION 1.0). This is important because people might have
local TxDb objects and they should be able to use them with the upcoming
release (BioC 3.1). So we need to keep GenomicFeatures compatible with these
old objects.

Add 'with.stop.codons' arg to makeTxDbFromGRanges(). If 'with.stop.codons' is
TRUE then the stop codons (corresponding to lines of type "stop_codon" in the
input) are considered to be part of the CDS and merged to them. Otherwise (the
default) the "stop_codon" lines are ignored.

Updates the code that handles exon filtering.

So we cannot infer exon rank information for transcripts that are
transpliced.  But we can still toss those out and proceed to infer the
rest when we encounter transcripts like that.  These changes support
this.

git-svn-id: file:///home/git/hedgehog.fhcrc.org/bioconductor/trunk/madman/Rpacks/GenomicFeatures@94572 bc3139a8-67e5-0310-9ffc-ced21a209358

Bug fixes and improvements to makeTranscriptDbFromBiomart():

- Fix long standing bug where the code in charge of inferring the CDSs from
  the UTRs would return CDSs spanning all the exons of a non-coding transcript.

- Fix an issue that was preventing the function from extracting the CDS
  information added recently to the datasets in the Ensembl Fungi, Ensembl
  Metazoa, Ensembl Plants, and Ensembl Protists databases. 

- Make the code in charge of extracting the CDSs more robust by taking
  advantage of new attributes (genomic_coding_start and genomic_coding_end)
  added by Ensembl in release 74 (Dec 2013), and by adding more sanity checks.

git-svn-id: file:///home/git/hedgehog.fhcrc.org/bioconductor/trunk/madman/Rpacks/GenomicFeatures@72888 bc3139a8-67e5-0310-9ffc-ced21a209358

Improve how makeTranscriptDbFromGFF() assigns internal feature ids. In
particular, when an exon or CDS belongs to more than 1 transcript (i.e. has
more than 1 mRNA id listed in its Parent attribute in the GFF file), now it
doesn't create several entries (and assign several ids) in the exon or cds
SQL table for that single feature.


git-svn-id: file:///home/git/hedgehog.fhcrc.org/bioconductor/trunk/madman/Rpacks/GenomicFeatures@72855 bc3139a8-67e5-0310-9ffc-ced21a209358

git-svn-id: file:///home/git/hedgehog.fhcrc.org/bioconductor/trunk/madman/Rpacks/GenomicFeatures@72844 bc3139a8-67e5-0310-9ffc-ced21a209358

Changes the way that exon ranks are inferred.

Performance enhancement to make inferring exon rankings about 10x faster.

I still think people should not normally use this though (so the warning stays).


git-svn-id: file:///home/git/hedgehog.fhcrc.org/bioconductor/trunk/madman/Rpacks/GenomicFeatures@72346 bc3139a8-67e5-0310-9ffc-ced21a209358

minor tweak to try and speed up processing of GFF files without indices.

Some GFF files don't have data to indicate exon rank.  When that
happens we can try to infer it.  This change should speed this process
up a bit.  Though really, I wonder if we support it at all since I
think it's a bad idea for people to do this.  That is, they should
really start with better files that don't require them to infer
anything (hence the warning when this feature is used).

git-svn-id: file:///home/git/hedgehog.fhcrc.org/bioconductor/trunk/madman/Rpacks/GenomicFeatures@68718 bc3139a8-67e5-0310-9ffc-ced21a209358

I wonder why 'feature.type' is exposed to the user if we know in advance exactly
what feature types are needed (gene, mRNA, exon, CDS). Furthermore, not
importing any of the first 3 feature types (gene, mRNA, exon) would break
makeTranscriptDbFromGFF(), and importing any additional feature type would
be a waste of CPU cycles and memory because they would not be used at all.
So I removed the 'feature.type' argument from the makeTranscriptDbFromGFF()
function.

git-svn-id: file:///home/git/hedgehog.fhcrc.org/bioconductor/trunk/madman/Rpacks/GenomicFeatures@65146 bc3139a8-67e5-0310-9ffc-ced21a209358

o 2 changes to makeTranscriptDbFromUCSC() and makeTranscriptDbFromBiomart():
  1) The chromosomes stored in the 'chrominfo' table are now stored in an order
     that "looks better", that is, when the user does seqlevels() on the
     resulting TranscriptDb object, the main chromosomes will show up first
     (in the order corresponding to their number), then the sex chromosomes,
     then U (if any), then M or MT (if any), etc...
     The exact logic used to produce this "good looking" order is implemented
     in GenomicRanges::makeSeqnameIds(), which makeTranscriptDbFromUCSC() and
     makeTranscriptDbFromBiomart() call.
  2) Now they call makeTranscriptDb() with 'reassign.ids=TRUE', which means
     that, for each type of feature (i.e. for transcript, exon, and cds), the
     internal ids are assigned in a way that is compatible with the order
     defined by ordering the features first by chromosome, then by strand,
     then by start, and finally by end. Some TranscriptDb accessors were
     actually doing this ordering at extraction time by using an expensive
     ORDER BY clause in the SELECT command (e.g. 'ORDER BY tx_chrom, tx_strand,
     tx_start, tx_end') but now they can use the much cheaper 'ORDER BY _tx_id'
     to obtain the same result.

o Speed up fiveUTRsByTranscript() and threeUTRsByTranscript() by a factor 2.5.


git-svn-id: file:///home/git/hedgehog.fhcrc.org/bioconductor/trunk/madman/Rpacks/GenomicFeatures@65144 bc3139a8-67e5-0310-9ffc-ced21a209358

Add 'reassign.ids' arg (FALSE by default) to makeTranscriptDb().

Bug fix corrects for problem caused by ensembl schem change

makeTranscriptDbFromBiomart() expected that all transcript names would
be unique, but ensembl decided to start including transcript models
from pseudoautosomal regions which means that now you can have a
single transcript that is associated with two different locations in
the genome (one form the X and one from the Y chromosome).

git-svn-id: file:///home/git/hedgehog.fhcrc.org/bioconductor/trunk/madman/Rpacks/GenomicFeatures@50759 bc3139a8-67e5-0310-9ffc-ced21a209358

Simplified the SQL query used by transcripts(), exons() and cds() to retrieve
the extra columns specified thru the 'columns' argument. Now one less SQL join
is used which can speed up things significantly in some situations.
For example 'transcripts(txdb, columns="gene_id")' (where 'txdb' is made from
the UCSC knownGene table for hg19) now takes only about 10 seconds instead of
several minutes.

git-svn-id: file:///home/git/hedgehog.fhcrc.org/bioconductor/trunk/madman/Rpacks/GenomicFeatures@49612 bc3139a8-67e5-0310-9ffc-ced21a209358

Adds circ_seqs argument to makeTranscriptDbFromUCSC and makeTranscriptDbFromBiomart

This adds the circ_seq argument to these two methods along with two
discovery methods to see what chromosomes are being pulled from a
given source.  Users are expected to pass in a character string to
indicate which things they want to be marked as circular.  The
discovery methods allow the user to see what strings they can choose
from.  A default character vector is also provided, exposed, and
documented to allow users to automatically mark most mitochondrial
sequences as circular, If there are other sequences that need to be so
marked, users can append to this default vector.

TranscriptDb object.

Like for makeTranscriptDbFromBiomart(), we try to guess this flag from the

git-svn-id: file:///home/git/hedgehog.fhcrc.org/bioconductor/trunk/madman/Rpacks/GenomicFeatures@49513 bc3139a8-67e5-0310-9ffc-ced21a209358

makeTranscriptDbFromBiomart() now stores the is_circularity flag in the
TranscriptDb object.

Unfortunately, as of Sep 21, 2010 (Ensembl release 59), Ensembl is still
not flagging circular sequences in their db (see this thread for the details
http://lists.ensembl.org/pipermail/dev/2010-September/000139.html), so, in the
meantime, we try to guess from the sequence names. But we will definitely need
something better!


git-svn-id: file:///home/git/hedgehog.fhcrc.org/bioconductor/trunk/madman/Rpacks/GenomicFeatures@49512 bc3139a8-67e5-0310-9ffc-ced21a209358

Modified internal utility .fetchChromLengthsFromEnsembl() so by default it
returns the lengths for all the top level sequences, not just for the
chromosomes. Note that the MT sequence (mitochondrial) is tagged as a
chromosome in some datasets (e.g. hsapiens_gene_ensembl) but not in others
(e.g. cporcellus_gene_ensembl). But hopefully it is always tagged as a top
level sequence so by default .fetchChromLengthsFromEnsembl() will always get
it (still need to check this though).

git-svn-id: file:///home/git/hedgehog.fhcrc.org/bioconductor/trunk/madman/Rpacks/GenomicFeatures@48874 bc3139a8-67e5-0310-9ffc-ced21a209358

GenomicFeatures 1.1.10

- Added 'use.names' arg (FALSE by default) to the following extractors:
  transcriptsBy(), exonsBy(), cdsBy(), intronsByTranscript(),
  fiveUTRsByTranscript(), threeUTRsByTranscript().
  This allows the user to choose how the returned object should be named: with
  the feature internal ids (not very informative but guaranteed to be defined
  and unique), or with the feature names (more informative but not guaranteed
  to be unique or even defined). 
- Renamed extractTranscriptsFromGenome() arg 'use.tx_id' -> 'use.names' for
  consistency with the new signature of the above extractors.


git-svn-id: file:///home/git/hedgehog.fhcrc.org/bioconductor/trunk/madman/Rpacks/GenomicFeatures@48831 bc3139a8-67e5-0310-9ffc-ced21a209358

Small updates and fixes to supportedUCSCtables().
Also improved error handling for when the user specifies a transcript table
that is listed in supportedUCSCtables() but that doesn't actually exist
(because supportedUCSCtables() is out-of-date).

git-svn-id: file:///home/git/hedgehog.fhcrc.org/bioconductor/trunk/madman/Rpacks/GenomicFeatures@48769 bc3139a8-67e5-0310-9ffc-ced21a209358

Complete rewrite of transcripts(), exons() and cds(). The new implementation
uses a high-level representation of the relational organization of the db.
This allows more code sharing between the 3 functions, a code that is more
generic, and the ability to support any db column in the 'vals' and 'columns'
arguments of these functions.

git-svn-id: file:///home/git/hedgehog.fhcrc.org/bioconductor/trunk/madman/Rpacks/GenomicFeatures@48718 bc3139a8-67e5-0310-9ffc-ced21a209358

Fixed pb in internal helper function .fetchChromLengthsFromEnsembl()
used by makeTranscriptDbFromBiomart().

Because the db accessible at ftp://ftp.ensembl.org/pub/current_mysql/
is not guaranteed to be in sync with the ENSEMBL GENES db available
thru biomaRt, .fetchChromLengthsFromEnsembl() was not guaranteed to
retrieve the chromosome lengths for the correct version of the
ENSEMBL GENES db. The function now retrieves this information from
ftp://ftp.ensembl.org/pub/release-NN/mysql/ where NN is the release
number (e.g. 58) of the ENSEMBL GENES db that is currently available
thru biomaRt.


git-svn-id: file:///home/git/hedgehog.fhcrc.org/bioconductor/trunk/madman/Rpacks/GenomicFeatures@48717 bc3139a8-67e5-0310-9ffc-ced21a209358

Fixed bug in transcripts() when trying to select by gene_id.
Thanks again to Erik van den Akker for the report.


git-svn-id: file:///home/git/hedgehog.fhcrc.org/bioconductor/trunk/madman/Rpacks/GenomicFeatures@48112 bc3139a8-67e5-0310-9ffc-ced21a209358

Fixed an inefficiency in helper function joinDataFrameWithName2Val()
when the data frame to join has a lot of rows that need to be dropped.
This was affecting makeTranscriptDbFromUCSC() when used with
tablename="refGene" (was taking about 45 minutes on Human or Mouse,
now takes less than 80s). Thanks to Erik van den Akker for reporting
this (https://stat.ethz.ch/pipermail/bioconductor/2010-July/034424.html)

Also made makeTranscriptDbFromUCSC() verbose (like 
makeTranscriptDbFromBiomart()) and added an SQL debugging mode that
can be toggled with GenomicFeatures:::debugSQL().

git-svn-id: file:///home/git/hedgehog.fhcrc.org/bioconductor/trunk/madman/Rpacks/GenomicFeatures@45105 bc3139a8-67e5-0310-9ffc-ced21a209358

Good bye SQLite R-trees!

They slow down our queries, make our TranscriptDb objects bigger, and, last
but not least, alter our feature starts/ends:
  sqlite> INSERT INTO exon_rtree VALUES (2, 16844685, 16844760);
  sqlite> select * from exon_rtree;
  2|16844684.0|16844760.0
           ^ off by one!

git-svn-id: file:///home/git/hedgehog.fhcrc.org/bioconductor/trunk/madman/Rpacks/GenomicFeatures@45012 bc3139a8-67e5-0310-9ffc-ced21a209358

2 important changes/fixes to the transcriptsBy functionality:

- Limited use of DISTINCT to type="exon" (or "cds") and by="gene".
  It would give wrong results when used systematically e.g. if a transcript
  contains twice the same exon, then this exon must show up twice in the
  exon composition of this transcript.

- transcriptsBy() was returning an object with a 'gene_id' col.
  When 'by' was "exon" or "cds", this column was actually containing the
  gene id inferred from the transcript-to-gene relationship. But we shouldn't
  do that because, in theory, this relationship is many-to-many (it's an
  important design decision that we've made early and now we need to be
  consistent with it). Also when 'by' was "gene", this column was actually
  redundant with the names of the top-level elements of the returned
  GRangesList object.
  I dropped the 'gene_id' col and, as a consequence of this, also dropped
  the join with the 'gene' table (was not needed anymore) so the SQL query
  should be slightly faster now.

TODO: For cdsBy() (and probably for exonsBy() too), return the exon_rank
column.

Fixed some issues with initial versions of transcriptsBy functions.

1. Did not select DISTINCT values, so in exonsBy groupBy="gene" can
    create multiple entries of the same exon within gene.
2. Did not filter out null values in groupBy variable, so grouping by
    CDS would produce an error if no CDS information is present.
3. Inefficient field selection via SELECT *.

Changes to the sorting and fields returned by transcriptsBy etc.

This simplifies what is returned by the *By category of functions so
that they are all returning data that pertains only to the ranges
requested.  Also sorting now has an implicit order to it.  Ordering is
done by exon rank where when grouping by transcripts, but by
chromosome location otherwise.

git-svn-id: file:///home/git/hedgehog.fhcrc.org/bioconductor/trunk/madman/Rpacks/GenomicFeatures@44022 bc3139a8-67e5-0310-9ffc-ced21a209358

Another round of changes to the db schema (last for now):
- Added CDS tables ('CDSs' + 'CDSs_rtree'). They are temporarily left empty!
- Renamed table 'exons_transcripts' -> 'splicings'. Cols are:
    o _tx_id INTEGER NOT NULL
    o exon_rank INTEGER NOT NULL
    o _exon_id INTEGER NOT NULL
    o _CDS_id INTEGER NULL


git-svn-id: file:///home/git/hedgehog.fhcrc.org/bioconductor/trunk/madman/Rpacks/GenomicFeatures@44021 bc3139a8-67e5-0310-9ffc-ced21a209358

More changes to the db schema:
- Use a short prefix for all col names ('tx_' for transcript cols, 'exon_'
  for exon cols, etc...).
- Shortened names of chrom cols ('*_chromosome' -> '*_chrom').


git-svn-id: file:///home/git/hedgehog.fhcrc.org/bioconductor/trunk/madman/Rpacks/GenomicFeatures@44019 bc3139a8-67e5-0310-9ffc-ced21a209358

Following up on the latest schema changes.

The internal ids ('_tx_id' and '_exon_id') are never exposed to the
user anymore and only used for the SQL joins. All the functions that
were returning some internal ids to the user are now returning the
external ids instead (i.e. 'tx_id' instead of '_tx_id' and 'exon_id'
instead of '_exon_id').


git-svn-id: file:///home/git/hedgehog.fhcrc.org/bioconductor/trunk/madman/Rpacks/GenomicFeatures@44018 bc3139a8-67e5-0310-9ffc-ced21a209358

Some schema changes:
  - Added 'tx_name' and 'exon_name' cols (TEXT). 'tx_name' is populated when
    the db is created from UCSC but remains empty when it's created from
    Ensembl. 'exon_name' is always empty and won't be used at all for now.
  - Changed definition of 'exon_id' col: now it's always UNIQUE NOT NULL (like
    the 'tx_id' col), so it's guaranteed to be populated wherever the data is
    coming from.
Added the 'txName' arg to makeTranscriptDb().

Fixes how makeTranscriptDbFromUCSC() infers the exon rank (and stores
it in the TranscriptDb object).

The exon rank inferred from the UCSC data is now consistent with
what Ensembl does for transcripts that are on the minus strand,
that is, the rightmost exon has rank 1 (so its end matches the
end of the transcript).

Modified saveFeatures() to take advantage of the latest improvements to
RSQLite::sqliteCopyDatabase() (in particular, it does better error
handling). As a consequence, the package now requires RSQLite >= 0.8-1.


git-svn-id: file:///home/git/hedgehog.fhcrc.org/bioconductor/trunk/madman/Rpacks/GenomicFeatures@43908 bc3139a8-67e5-0310-9ffc-ced21a209358

Modified how makeTranscriptDb() generates internal exon ids to accomodate
Ensembl annotations.

When the 'exonId' arg is supplied, now makeTranscriptDb() uses it to generate
the internal exon ids instead of trying to generate them based on the exon
loci. This is compatible with the way Ensembl assigns exon ids (in their
annotations, 2 exons with the same genomic locus can be assigned 2 distinct
ids).

git-svn-id: file:///home/git/hedgehog.fhcrc.org/bioconductor/trunk/madman/Rpacks/GenomicFeatures@43724 bc3139a8-67e5-0310-9ffc-ced21a209358

A bug fix + lots of small changes:
- Fixed UCSCTranscripts() so that all UCSC start positions are now
  converted to 1-base before being sent to the db.
- Added UCSCknownGene_sample.rda: a small serialized data.frame obtained
  by extracting a few rows (<= 3 per chromosome) from the UCSC knownGene
  table for hg18. Will be used later for testing makeTranscripts().
- Added rtracklayer, biomaRt, DBI, RSQLite, AnnotationDbi and annotate to
  the Imports field (and removed them from the Depends field).
- Renamed some makeTranscripts() args ('ids' -> 'txId', 'geneIds' ->
  'geneId') for more consistency with other argument names.
- Renamed UCSCTranscripts() arg 'type' -> 'track'.
- Renamed 'con' slot of TranscriptAnnotation objects -> 'conn' (more
  consistent with DBI and AnnotationDbi).
- Export the GenomicAnnotation and TranscriptAnnotation classes.
- Made consistent use of the "TranscriptAnnotation object" term in the doc
  (in place of "Transcripts objects", "Transcript Object", "Transcript
  Database", etc...).
- Changed the signature (order and names of the 2 first args) of the
  getTranscripts()/getExons() generics so they adhere to the original specs.

Make test for makeIdsForUniqueRows not depend on Locale

makeIdsForUniqueRows depends on sorting input data.  The sorting
depends on the user's locale setting.  For now, we've modified the
test so it should work on all locales.  We may want to enforce a "C"
locale for this operation.
